content.description: Sit start on west side very short arete and make a couple moves to the top of the flat top boulder
content.location: First boulder down hill to the west of meadow. Â Obvious flat top boulder that one can sit on and look at the views west!!!

content.description: Fun problem in an awesome setting. Start sitting on a crimp rail in the middle of the most obvious overhanging face in the boulder field. Find good low feet and move right to a vertical pocket, then bump out left to a crimp sidepull. Compress and bring up your feet, then throw for the sloper and jug over the lip and top out straight up. Possibly harder for climbers with a smaller reach, or easier for those with a big one.
content.protection: Landing is excellent, FA was done without pads, so one pad should be more than enough.
content.location: Located in the main boulder field on top of Spruce Knob, on the overhanging block boulder with a fantastic view of the valley.
